title: No, Bhim Army Chief's 'Real' Name Is Not Naseemuddin Khan
subtitle: Chandra Shekhar Azad, Bhim Army chief took to Twitter to rubbish the claim about his name.
author: www.boomlive.in
vclaim:
A Twitter account named 'Hindu First' falsely claimed that 

Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad's 'real' name is Naseemuddin Khan. Azad took to Twitter to rubbish the viral post.

The tweet which has gained around 1,500 retweets and 2600 likes on Twitter states, "Bhim Army leader Chandrasekhar Ravan's real name is Naseemuddin Khan. How many people knew this? This is a devious move by Muslims to divide Hindus"

Click here to view the tweet and here for an archive

The false claim is also viral on Facebook with the same caption. A Facebook user named 'Arun Kumar Shukla' shared the claim in a post which has gained around 1,900 shares.

Click here to view the post and here for an archive.

Azad took to Twitter rubbishing the false claim tweeting, "I have not stopped laughing since I read this post. Well, the name Naseemuddin is not bad"

Azad responded to BOOM on Twitter and blamed Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) for the viral post. He said, "The BJP does these thing to defame me." ("ये भाजपा के लोग बदनाम करने के लिए ऐसी चीजें करवाते है")

Quint debunked this misleading piece of information on June 18, 2019.

BOOM has previously fact-checked misleading information that is communal in nature circulating on social media on public personalities. (here, here, and here)
